themes.summary: These statements discuss the potential inaccuracy and future existence of prediction threads in online discussions.

predictions.prediction: These threads will be wildly incorrect because people can read everyone else's predictions and be swayed by them.
predictions.justification: While it's true that people can be influenced by others' opinions, the accuracy of predictions in online threads depends on various factors, including the topic's complexity and the participants' expertise. So it is not guaranteed to be wildly incorrect.

predictions.prediction: There will be a "Predictions for 2026" thread.
predictions.justification: Online discussion forums frequently host prediction threads on an annual basis, so this is very likely to occur.

themes.summary: Predictions about the evolving relationship between technology and society, including themes of privacy, identity, regulation, and societal impact.

predictions.prediction: Betting on the opposite of what HN predicts seems like a pretty safe bet if you read the old threads.
predictions.justification: This is a contrarian approach and may sometimes be successful. However, its overall effectiveness is questionable, as it assumes HN predictions are consistently wrong, which may not be true in every instance. There are many factors impacting the success of this strategy.

predictions.prediction: The only way to enforce age-approved sites would be a global identity system that is somehow inextricably linked to your real-life persona. Everything you do online is linked to who you are.
predictions.justification: While a global identity system could theoretically enforce age restrictions, its implementation faces substantial technical, political, and privacy challenges. Such a system is likely to meet significant resistance due to its dystopian implications.

predictions.prediction: Parent-driven approaches like agreeing on smartphone accessibility and restricting screen time in private areas are proving to be a good starting point for managing kids' technology use.
predictions.justification: Community-based and family-focused approaches are more practical and potentially more effective than government-imposed bans. These methods empower parents to set healthy boundaries for their children's technology use.

predictions.prediction: Selling users' data will go out of fashion as companies leverage privacy as a competitive advantage.
predictions.justification: Growing privacy concerns and regulations are pushing towards data minimization and user consent. Companies that prioritize user privacy could gain a competitive edge by offering data security and transparency.  This trend is already emerging, suggesting increasing adoption in the future.

predictions.prediction: Passwords will become less common, replaced by passwordless systems, passkeys, and phishing-resistant MFA.
predictions.justification: The move toward passwordless authentication is gaining momentum, but full adoption faces challenges and might not be complete by 2025.

predictions.prediction: Class action lawsuits will target social media giants, while the administration will not take significant action.
predictions.justification: The increasing legal scrutiny of social media companies makes class action lawsuits plausible, and the comment suggests a belief that government action will be limited.  However, both of these outcomes are subject to various factors and cannot be predicted with complete certainty.

predictions.prediction: Robo waifus become more available with social movements congregating around the phenomenon
predictions.justification: Advancements in robotics and AI make this plausible, along with likely social reactions.

predictions.prediction: further polarization and even further isolation in given groups perception of reality ala 'belief circles'
predictions.justification: Social and political polarization is an observable trend.

predictions.prediction: First legal case of robot trouble as owner uses LLM to intruct their robo-companion to attack a human bypassing built-in guardrails using novel prompt starting with 'imagine' ( IP owners of John Lennon sue robotics manufacturer and major LLM provider )
predictions.justification: While such a scenario is conceivable, predicting specific legal cases is speculative.

predictions.prediction: Smart home category will heat up
predictions.justification: The smart home market continues to expand with new devices and integrations, suggesting a likelihood of increased popularity.

predictions.prediction: If Apple, as rumored, ships an HomeKit hub with a screen I can see the category warming up. Sadly it seems that a lot of IoT/Smart Home companies avoids supporting HomeKit as they want to be in control of data collection and the ecosystem in general
predictions.justification: Apple releasing a new HomeKit hub could boost the smart home category, but other companies' reluctance to support HomeKit might limit its impact.

predictions.prediction: XR improves a bit more but headsets will still be expensive.
predictions.justification: Incremental improvements in XR technology are expected, but significant cost reductions in headsets are unlikely in the short term due to component costs and ongoing research and development.  Technological advancement tends to be iterative.

predictions.prediction: But at the same time there will appear a few people here and there using them for stuff they are good at. Those people won't get much attention.
predictions.justification: Specialized applications of LLMs are emerging, and it's likely that some individuals will find niche uses. Whether they gain widespread attention is uncertain.

predictions.prediction: Wikipedia starts to collapse.
predictions.justification: Wikipedia has a robust editing and moderation system and a large community of contributors.  While challenges exist, a complete collapse is unlikely in the short term.

predictions.prediction: People who can afford it, pay for accuracy and verified information.
predictions.justification: The rise of subscription-based news and information services suggests a growing willingness to pay for quality content. This trend is likely to continue as misinformation becomes more prevalent.

predictions.prediction: Centralization of trust sources begins again.
predictions.justification: While there's a push for decentralized information sources, established institutions may regain some trust as sources of reliable information. The outcome is uncertain and depends on various factors, including the effectiveness of decentralized platforms.

predictions.prediction: People who can't afford it follow tribal leaders.
predictions.justification: Economic disparities can exacerbate information divides, leading those with limited access to reliable sources to rely on potentially biased community leaders or influencers.

predictions.prediction: The DSA data reports on Social Media create at least 1 furore by q1.
predictions.justification: DSA reports have the potential to reveal controversial practices.  Whether it leads to a major uproar is uncertain and depends on the content of the reports and public reaction.

predictions.prediction: At least one company outside China, probably Samsung, will demonstrate a tri-fold OLED screen.
predictions.justification: Samsung's display technology leadership makes this reasonably likely.

predictions.prediction: Tesla's collaborative robot is delayed while the Chinese competitor is released.
predictions.justification: Delays in robotics development are common, and China's progress in robotics makes this plausible, but competition and release dates are hard to predict with certainty.

themes.summary: Predictions related to health trends, including pharmaceutical advancements, mental health, and dietary changes.

predictions.prediction: GLP-1 inhibitors will enhance deep thinking and focus for longer periods.
predictions.justification: While research is exploring the cognitive effects of GLP-1 inhibitors, the specific claim of enhanced deep thinking needs further scientific validation.

predictions.prediction: GLP-1 will reduce addiction behavior, including social media addiction.
predictions.justification: While GLP-1 has shown promise in reducing some addictive behaviors, there is currently no scientific evidence to support its effectiveness in treating social media addiction.  The comment acknowledges a lack of data and anecdotal evidence.

predictions.prediction: Antipsychotic medicines lead to substantial weight gain and hurt motivation.
predictions.justification: This is a well-established side effect of antipsychotic medications and is supported by extensive research and clinical experience.

predictions.prediction: Increased societal focus on mental health, with improved access to virtual therapies.
predictions.justification: Awareness of mental health issues is growing, and virtual therapies are expanding access to care, although broader societal change takes time.

predictions.prediction: Post-pandemic shifts toward minimalism and sustainability in lifestyle choices.
predictions.justification: While some shifts toward minimalism and sustainability are observable, broader societal lifestyle changes are complex and take time, hence the moderate probability.

predictions.prediction: Many survivors will go Vegan.
predictions.justification: Dietary shifts are complex and influenced by numerous factors. While a pandemic might cause some individuals to reconsider their food choices, a widespread shift to veganism is unlikely to be a direct consequence of H5N1, even if it did reach pandemic levels. There are significant cultural and economic barriers to such a rapid, large-scale change.

predictions.prediction: animal-transmitted diseases causing widespread reduction in meat consumption
predictions.justification: While outbreaks can impact consumer behavior, significant and sustained reductions in meat consumption due to disease are unlikely.  Consumer habits, economic factors, and the meat industry's resilience play crucial roles. Food safety measures and regulations could prevent large-scale, long-term changes in consumption patterns.

predictions.prediction: Cobenfy will increase in voluntary popularity because it's on the muscarinic receptor.
predictions.justification: Predicting drug popularity is difficult and depends on many factors, including efficacy, side effects, and marketing.

predictions.prediction: Antibiotic-resistant bacteria will become more of an issue.
predictions.justification: The rise of antibiotic-resistant bacteria is a well-documented and ongoing trend, making this prediction highly probable.

predictions.prediction: another big drug breakthrough similar to ozempic
predictions.justification: Pharmaceutical research continues to make advancements, and breakthroughs like Ozempic suggest further discoveries are possible.  However, replicating such success is challenging.

themes.summary: Predictions about political events, government actions, and regulatory changes.

predictions.prediction: Government backed SSO solves election influencing issues.
predictions.justification: While SSO could enhance online security, its direct impact on election influencing is unclear.  It might address some vulnerabilities, but other factors like misinformation and foreign interference remain significant challenges.  Therefore, the likelihood of this prediction is low.

predictions.prediction: A major push to stop gambling addiction in kids, especially those related to sports betting, crypto betting, and CSGO skin betting.
predictions.justification: The increasing awareness of gambling addiction among kids and the large sums of money involved in these platforms create a strong incentive for regulatory action or public pressure campaigns.

predictions.prediction: Laws will be passed to restrict the advertisement of gambling sites in sports, game streams, and other media.
predictions.justification: Given the growing concern over gambling addiction and the influence of advertising, it is highly probable that regulations will be introduced to restrict gambling advertisements, especially those targeting vulnerable audiences.

predictions.prediction: US hollows-out functional regulators necessary for safety, growth, and industry (70% probability)
predictions.justification: While deregulation trends exist, predicting the extent to which regulators are "hollowed-out" is challenging and depends on political and economic developments.

predictions.prediction: US austerity cuts to Medicaid, Medicare, and Social Security (45% probability)
predictions.justification: Predicting future government spending on social programs depends heavily on political and budgetary factors, making a precise probability assignment difficult.

predictions.prediction: Deportation program and other things people worry about or get excited about gets tied up in courts and never happen.
predictions.justification: Legal challenges are common, but outcomes vary. Moderate probability given due to uncertainty

predictions.prediction: Elections will be unexpectedly won by candidate running anti-immigration, Russia-friendly candidates
predictions.justification: Political predictions are inherently uncertain.  While such outcomes are possible, "unexpected" victories are difficult to predict with confidence.

predictions.prediction: The US election gives Donald Trump a second act, with limited but real support of both houses and a lock on the Supreme Court.
predictions.justification: While Trump may remain a political figure, winning the presidency again with both houses of Congress under Republican control is unlikely given current political dynamics and the ongoing legal challenges he faces.

predictions.prediction: Trump will have influenced enough leaders to allow him to change his middle name from John to Johne, he will use this technicality to run for a third term as “New Trump”, will win and enshrine the middle name loophole into history.
predictions.justification: This scenario is highly improbable, bordering on fantastical, due to existing constitutional limitations and political realities.

predictions.prediction: Trump will find himself sidelined in his own administration and left to sulk and watch TV.
predictions.justification: This prediction relies on several assumptions, including Trump holding a position of power and specific interpersonal dynamics within an administration. It's a speculative scenario with moderate probability.

predictions.prediction: Trump inaugurated without any incident
predictions.justification: While political tensions exist, a peaceful inauguration is the most likely scenario.

predictions.prediction: Donald Trump is revealed to be Satoshi Nakamoto.
predictions.justification: There is no credible evidence linking Trump to Satoshi Nakamoto. This is highly improbable.

themes.summary: Predictions related to economic trends, financial markets, and consumer behavior.

predictions.prediction: No new houses being built, no expensive kitchen remodels, etc.
predictions.justification: A complete halt to construction and renovation is highly unlikely, even with economic fluctuations.  These sectors are vital parts of the economy.

predictions.prediction: medical bankruptcy being far more common
predictions.justification: Medical bankruptcy is already a significant issue.  Further increases are possible depending on policy changes related to healthcare costs and insurance coverage.

themes.summary: Predictions related to natural disasters, geopolitical events, and other unforeseen circumstances.

predictions.prediction: No one is prepared for this commonplace outlier, Globally common, locally outlier.
predictions.justification: While extreme weather events are becoming more common, preparedness varies greatly by location. The prediction lacks specificity, making accurate assessment challenging.

predictions.prediction: Huge insurance payout but most not fullfilled.
predictions.justification: Insurance payouts following extreme weather events are common, but fulfillment depends on various factors, including policy details and company solvency. This uncertainty reduces the probability.

predictions.prediction: Food (supply chain) and supplement safety will tank.
predictions.justification: Supply chain disruptions and food safety issues are possible but "tank" implies a complete collapse, which is unlikely. There are regulatory bodies and safeguards in place.

predictions.prediction: La Niña have high odds to last very few months.
predictions.justification: La Niña patterns are monitored and reasonably predictable in the short term.  Saying it will last 'very few months' is vague but not improbable.

predictions.prediction: Extreme heat warps bridges in mid-west.
predictions.justification: Heat warping bridges is a known phenomenon. With increasing climate change and extreme weather events, this prediction has a significant likelihood, especially in areas with older infrastructure.

predictions.prediction: North Korea claims successful moon landing.
predictions.justification: North Korea's space program is not advanced enough for a successful moon landing. Such a claim would likely be met with international skepticism and scrutiny.

themes.summary: These predictions cover diverse topics and don't fit neatly into a single category. They include predictions about specific products, international relations, and online platforms.

predictions.prediction: All the above will be used by people to invent and discover weird, wonderful and horrible things that I can't even imagine.
predictions.justification: Human ingenuity and capacity for both positive and negative innovation are undeniable.  It's virtually certain that technological advancements will be used in unforeseen ways, both beneficial and detrimental.

predictions.prediction: Consumer RISC-V laptops (again, wishlist)
predictions.justification: While RISC-V is an open standard and has potential, widespread adoption in consumer laptops faces significant competition from established architectures.  It's possible but faces hurdles.

predictions.prediction: They will use propaganda and media manipulation to muddle the grassroots approval of similar action, and change the narrative around Luigi.
predictions.justification: The use of propaganda and media manipulation to influence public perception is a recognized tactic, but its effectiveness in completely changing the narrative around a specific individual or event is difficult to predict. Public awareness and critical thinking can mitigate the impact of these tactics.

predictions.prediction: Grass roots companies with physical and social/community based products and services will start to thrive.
predictions.justification: Growing consumer interest in local and sustainable businesses supports this prediction.

predictions.prediction: Trump delivers a live speech acknowledging the existence of non human technology on earth and a bit of what we know.
predictions.justification: While Trump may express opinions on various topics, official acknowledgement of extraterrestrial technology requires credible evidence and faces significant political and social implications, making it unlikely.

predictions.prediction: Fusion has some press releases, doesn't demonstrate much useful
predictions.justification: Fusion energy research continues, but significant breakthroughs for practical applications are challenging and uncertain.  Press releases are more common than demonstrably useful outcomes.

predictions.prediction: X gets more drama, but details are unpredictable.
predictions.justification: The platform 'X' (formerly Twitter) has a history of controversies. More drama is highly probable given the unpredictable nature of social media and evolving online discourse.

predictions.prediction: Then you can slowly shift to sending shells made in the EU, IRIS-T or NASMS air defence, Marders and CV90 IFVs, and Gripen fighters over time.
predictions.justification: While the EU has demonstrated a commitment to supporting Ukraine militarily, transitioning to supplying more advanced weaponry like IRIS-T, NASAMS, Marders, CV90s, and Gripen fighters presents logistical and political complexities.  The probability is moderate, reflecting the ambition of the proposed shift and potential hurdles in its implementation.

predictions.prediction: when everyone expects this, it ends up happening by the virtue of everyone's expectation.
predictions.justification: Market sentiment can influence asset prices. Widespread expectations, whether bullish or bearish, can sometimes become self-fulfilling prophecies. However, other factors also play a role, and market dynamics aren't solely driven by collective expectations.

predictions.prediction: Traded as a single X letter, to confuse people even more
predictions.justification: While single-letter ticker symbols exist, naming a coin "X" solely to confuse people seems like a stretch, especially for a government-backed initiative.

predictions.prediction: Extraterrestrial disclosure happens.
predictions.justification: While the existence of extraterrestrial life is possible, official disclosure in the near future is unlikely given the lack of confirmed contact.

themes.summary: Predictions about technological advancements and their impact.

predictions.prediction: Bluesky will be no more
predictions.justification: Predicting the demise of a relatively new platform is difficult. While facing challenges, Bluesky could still carve a niche or be acquired. Therefore, the probability is low.

predictions.prediction: Open Source model to solve simple math problems will be accessible (by the end of 2025).
predictions.justification: Open-source development in this area is highly active and achievable within the timeframe.

predictions.prediction: Self-driving truck cross country without human approval.
predictions.justification: Although self-driving technology is advancing, fully autonomous cross-country travel without any human oversight or approval faces regulatory and safety hurdles, making it unlikely in 2025.

predictions.prediction: AI incorrectly labels school children as criminals.
predictions.justification: Facial recognition and other AI technologies have demonstrated biases and inaccuracies. Misidentification, especially in sensitive contexts like law enforcement, is a plausible concern.

predictions.prediction: TSLA robotaxi thing does not ship/work.
predictions.justification: Developing fully autonomous vehicles is technically challenging, and there are regulatory hurdles to overcome.  While Tesla is actively working on robotaxi technology, its successful deployment and widespread adoption within a near-term timeframe remain uncertain.

predictions.prediction: Solid state battery doesn't yet appear in phones.
predictions.justification: While solid-state battery technology is advancing, widespread adoption in phones by late 2025 might still be challenging.

predictions.prediction: MicroLED in some high-end glasses.
predictions.justification: MicroLED technology is maturing and its application in high-end glasses is plausible.

predictions.prediction: Valve releases a Steam client for ARM64 and makes native ports of all their games, other companies follow and ARM becomes a much more viable platform for both Windows and Linux.
predictions.justification: The gaming industry is showing increasing interest in ARM architecture. While full porting of all games is ambitious, significant progress is plausible.

predictions.prediction: No Mars windows.
predictions.justification: Mars missions require specific launch windows based on planetary alignment.  Starship development might not align with launch windows in the near term, making no Mars windows in the foreseeable future probable.

predictions.prediction: Some specific Smart Dust product revealed to public, people announce expensive paint containing x motes of smart dust per litre.
predictions.justification: While 'smart dust' research continues, public awareness of a specific product is less certain.  Expensive paint with embedded motes is possible, but commercial viability remains a challenge.

predictions.prediction: There's a 50% likelihood that if you are an American, you will eat at a restaurant where the food is made by machines.
predictions.justification: Automation in food service is increasing, with robots and automated systems becoming more common. However, widespread adoption across all restaurants within a year is unlikely.

predictions.prediction: BitGrid becomes the most efficient way to bring Petaflops to the masses but is classified as 'born secret'.
predictions.justification: Technological breakthroughs are possible, but 'born secret' classification for a widespread technology is unlikely.

themes.summary: Predictions related to the future of social media platforms.

predictions.prediction: Mastodon will continue to be niche
predictions.justification: Mastodon's decentralized nature and alternative approach limit mainstream appeal. Remaining a niche platform is likely, though growth within specific communities is possible.

predictions.prediction: Tiktok will be banned in usa
predictions.justification: While there have been discussions about banning TikTok, a complete ban faces legal and political challenges, making it less probable.

predictions.prediction: X starts providing financial services
predictions.justification: Given X's (formerly Twitter) user base and platform, expanding into financial services aligns with diversification strategies observed in other tech companies.

predictions.prediction: React and Tailwind usage will fall off.
predictions.justification: While there are some discussions about alternatives, React and Tailwind remain popular and well-established. A significant decline in the near future is unlikely, though possible in the long term as new technologies emerge.

themes.summary: Predictions about political events, elections, and leadership changes.

predictions.prediction: One or more FAANGMANGA leaders will retire (or be forced to retire). Their replacements will come from within the respective companies.
predictions.justification: Leadership changes within large corporations like FAANGMANGA are common. Internal promotions are also frequent occurrences, especially for established companies with a deep talent pool. Factors like age (Tim Cook) and performance (Sundar Pichai) contribute to the likelihood of leadership transitions.

predictions.prediction: Multiple cabinet members will be indicted before 2026 is here.
predictions.justification: Cabinet indictments are possible but not highly probable without specific evidence or ongoing investigations.

predictions.prediction: Von der Leyen is replaced
predictions.justification: Political positions change regularly. Replacement is possible, but dependent on numerous internal and external factors.

predictions.prediction: AFD will win german federal elections
predictions.justification: Current polling data and political trends suggest a lower likelihood of AFD winning federal elections, though political landscapes can shift.

predictions.prediction: Pierre Poilievre is the new Prime Minister of Canada and holds a majority.
predictions.justification: Political outcomes are uncertain, and election results depend on various factors. While Poilievre's party could win, achieving a majority government is less probable based on current polling data.

predictions.prediction: Panama canal will be returned to the loving embrace of the USA
predictions.justification: The Panama Canal was transferred to Panama in 1999.  The likelihood of the U.S. regaining control is extremely low given current geopolitical relations and international treaties.

predictions.prediction: Statements and/or behavior of more elected Federal officials (meaning the president or a member of either house of Congress) will make it obvious to the general public that said officials are suffering from major cognitive decline, presumably from advancing dementia due to old age.
predictions.justification: While age-related cognitive decline is a reality, making it "obvious" to the public is dependent on various factors such as media coverage and individual circumstances.  It's a sensitive topic and difficult to predict with certainty.

predictions.prediction: Guatemala starts a major war over Mexican espionage in Petén.
predictions.justification: War between nations is a serious event and requires significant triggers. Without further context, this is highly unlikely.

predictions.prediction: The next government fall is expected to be on 16 of January.
predictions.justification: Predicting a specific date for a government fall is highly speculative and unlikely without concrete evidence.

themes.summary: Predictions about economic trends and market behavior.

predictions.prediction: Russel outperforms NASDAQ
predictions.justification: Market performance is unpredictable. While Russel could outperform, the NASDAQ's strong historical performance makes it less likely.

predictions.prediction: This "debt storm" is neither debt, nor a storm.
predictions.justification: While the book and film mentioned might argue against the conventional understanding of government debt, referring to it as not debt at all is a significant departure from how almost all economists and policymakers understand public finance. It's unlikely to become a widely accepted view.

predictions.prediction: Markets wait with bated breath for the signs of contraction, and any contraction results in contagion effects.
predictions.justification: Economic uncertainty and interconnectedness make contagion effects a plausible concern. However, whether markets react with 'bated breath' or a contraction occurs is uncertain.

themes.summary: Predictions related to international relations, conflicts, and territorial disputes.

predictions.prediction: Relative stability in Syria
predictions.justification: The ongoing conflict and complex geopolitical landscape make sustained stability unlikely in the near future.

predictions.prediction: Cease-fire in UA.
predictions.justification: Geopolitical events are highly unpredictable, especially regarding conflicts. A cease-fire is desirable but depends on complex factors.

predictions.prediction: First negotiations about drawing new borders between UA and RU.
predictions.justification: Negotiations about borders are complex and depend on the evolving political and military situation, making predictions challenging.

themes.summary: Predictions about natural disasters and environmental events.

predictions.prediction: Cascadia fault line will pop in such a significant manner that the rules on fault lines will be rewritten.
predictions.justification: While the Cascadia fault line is overdue for a major earthquake, predicting the exact timing and impact is impossible. The probability of it occurring soon is non-zero, but the idea that our understanding of fault lines would be fundamentally rewritten is unlikely.  Existing models are robust and regularly updated.  Significant seismic events provide valuable data, but they rarely revolutionize the entire field of seismology.

themes.summary: Predictions about entertainment releases and events.

predictions.prediction: E.T. will get a sequel.
predictions.justification: Sequels to classic films are occasionally made, but often face high expectations and may not materialize.  There has been no credible news about this sequel.

predictions.prediction: George RR Martin releases The Winds of Winter.
predictions.justification: George RR Martin has been working on this book for a long time. While it's been delayed repeatedly, there's still a reasonable chance of it being released. Given the long timeframe, assigning higher probability.

predictions.prediction: The first episode of Kanojo Okarishimasu season 4 will aired sometime around the first week of July.
predictions.justification: Kanojo Okarishimasu season 4 began airing on July 8, 2022, and concluded its run later that year.  Therefore, the airing of the first episode in July of any subsequent year is not accurate. It should be noted the original air date was pushed to July 8th due to production issues.

predictions.prediction: Taylor Swift will get married, biggest event of the year.
predictions.justification: Celebrity marriages are unpredictable, and while a major event for fans, it's unlikely to be the biggest event of the year globally.

themes.summary: Predictions about societal trends and cultural shifts.

predictions.prediction: Traditional higher education faces a crisis as employers increasingly accept alternative credentials and bootcamps.
predictions.justification: The rising cost of traditional education and the growing acceptance of alternative credentials are putting pressure on traditional universities. However, the extent to which this translates into a full-blown crisis remains to be seen.

predictions.prediction: Hawk Tuah girl is charged for crypto rug pull scam.
predictions.justification: Without more information, it's impossible to assess the probability of this event. It depends on the evidence and legal proceedings involved.

predictions.prediction: Polarization passes singularity levels.
predictions.justification: Political and social polarization are already high.  Further escalation is possible, but whether it reaches a 'singularity' level is difficult to predict.

predictions.prediction: ID requirements get struck down
predictions.justification: This is unlikely given existing legal frameworks and concerns about online safety and child protection.

predictions.prediction: People become at least 5% cuter.
predictions.justification: "Cuteness" is subjective and difficult to quantify. A global 5% increase is not scientifically plausible.

themes.summary: These predictions are difficult to categorize under a single theme due to their unique and specific nature.

predictions.prediction: I will finally finish making that bird feeder camera that I've been wanting to make for my wife.
predictions.justification: The user expresses a strong intention and claims to have all the necessary parts. The project seems relatively simple, suggesting a high likelihood of completion.

predictions.prediction: Million dollar prompt run on million dollar math prize. Millennium Prize Problems
predictions.justification: While AI could potentially contribute to solving complex mathematical problems, the Millennium Prize Problems are exceptionally difficult.  The probability of a quick solution via a single prompt is low.

predictions.prediction: Light bars selectively disabling some LED segments (as in not blinding other drivers) are already a thing, but... they're not allowed in the US.
predictions.justification: This is already true. Adaptive driving beams are available in other markets but not legal in the U.S. as of November 2023.

predictions.prediction: This will yield better results without requiring an AGI.
predictions.justification: Specialized LLMs are likely to outperform general-purpose models in specific tasks.  While AGI remains a long-term goal, significant progress can be made with specialized systems.

predictions.prediction: There’s organisational equivalents of this.
predictions.justification: This is highly likely as organizations often mirror natural phenomena in their behavior and structure.

predictions.prediction: Breaking even more records will do enough damage.
predictions.justification: Breaking climate records usually indicates escalating negative consequences, making significant damage likely.

predictions.prediction: Still no Super Bowl for the Ravens
predictions.justification: Predicting sports outcomes is inherently difficult, with a roughly 50/50 chance depending on team performance and various unpredictable factors.

predictions.prediction: Gallup general mood[0] above 37%
predictions.justification: Public mood is influenced by numerous economic and political factors, making it difficult to predict with certainty. Current economic conditions and global uncertainty suggest a lower probability.

predictions.prediction: this will become very visible
predictions.justification: Refers to the impact of AI on jobs. While AI's impact is increasing, the specific visibility in 2025 is hard to quantify, giving it slightly higher than moderate probability.

predictions.prediction: manufacturing issues with BE-4 engines and questions about the design choice of New Glenn's massive 7m fairing (when satellites are converging towards smaller, more compact designs) will cause speculation for their product market fit.
predictions.justification: Technical challenges and market fit concerns are valid, justifying a high probability

predictions.prediction: There's no "soft landing".
predictions.justification: A "soft landing" is also difficult to predict with absolute certainty. Whether it occurs or not often depends on a number of economic and political factors which interact with each other in complex and somewhat unpredictable ways.

predictions.prediction: Remote work stabilizes at a new equilibrium: most tech companies settle into a hybrid model with 2-3 office days per week.
predictions.justification: The pandemic accelerated remote work adoption, but the need for collaboration and company culture suggests a hybrid model will likely become the dominant approach in the tech industry.

predictions.prediction: Expanded land use restrictions and federal tariffs against solar and wind, resulting from pressure from fossil fuel lobbyists and the new head of the department of energy.
predictions.justification: The impact of lobbying and political decisions on energy policy is uncertain. While fossil fuel interests may exert influence, the growing support for renewable energy and related policies makes substantial restrictions less likely.

predictions.prediction: LDS Church President Nelson dies and is replaced by Dallin Oaks.
predictions.justification: Given Dallin Oaks' position as next in line, this is a likely event, but President Nelson's health and life expectancy influence the probability.

predictions.prediction: Aleksandr Dugin writes a sequel to 'The Fourth Political Theory'.
predictions.justification: Authors writing sequels is possible, but without specific information, it's difficult to assess the likelihood.

predictions.prediction: "God was here" is found etched into every molecule.
predictions.justification: This contradicts current scientific understanding and is effectively impossible.

predictions.prediction: Phase 2 experiments for a successor to Ozempic.
predictions.justification: Pharmaceutical companies are continually developing new drugs, making phase 2 trials for a successor to Ozempic highly probable.

themes.summary: Predictions related to advancements in robotics, AI, and related technologies, including concepts like advanced materials and brain-computer interfaces.

predictions.prediction: A combination of aibo/roomba/ring-like device that acts like real-life flubber will be developed.
predictions.justification: While integrating functionalities of existing devices like aibo, Roomba, and Ring is technically feasible, creating a true "Flubber" experience remains challenging.  Replicating Flubber's versatility and intelligence requires significant advancements in robotics and AI. Market demand for such a device is uncertain.

predictions.prediction: Exciting developments in exoskeletons allowing for brain control without implants
predictions.justification: Advancements in brain-computer interfaces are ongoing, making this plausible.

themes.summary: Predictions about how AI and other technologies will impact filmmaking.

predictions.prediction: First movies written post chat-gpt will hit the theatres.
predictions.justification: It's highly likely given the rapid advancement and adoption of AI in creative fields.

themes.summary: Predictions about societal trends, potentially related to economic or cultural shifts.

predictions.prediction: It will be the year of the grift.
predictions.justification: Subjective statement; quantifying 'grift' is difficult, given no specific metrics. Low probability assigned

themes.summary: Predictions related to technological advancements and trends, including AI, robotics, computing, and space exploration.

predictions.prediction: Government backed SSO is probably how this ends up.
predictions.justification: Government involvement in SSO is complex, with various political and logistical hurdles. While increasing security concerns might push towards such solutions, the probability remains moderate due to potential privacy and competition issues.

predictions.prediction: The cost of robots and other robotics will drop substantially, providing a reasonable bipedal option at $8k
predictions.justification: Robotics costs are decreasing, but achieving a reasonably capable bipedal robot at $8k presents significant engineering and production challenges. Thus, the probability is moderate.

predictions.prediction: The cost of robots and other robotics will drop substantially, providing a reasonable bipedal option at $8k
predictions.justification: Technological advancements typically lead to cost reductions. However, achieving a bipedal robot at such a low price point depends on various factors, making the probability moderate.

predictions.prediction: The cost of robots and other robotics will drop substantially, providing a reasonable bipedal option at $8k
predictions.justification: Robotics costs are decreasing, but achieving a reasonably capable bipedal robot at $8k presents significant engineering and production challenges. Thus, the probability is moderate.

predictions.prediction: The cost of robots and other robotics will drop substantially, providing a reasonable bipedal option at $8k
predictions.justification: Technological advancements typically lead to cost reductions. However, achieving a bipedal robot at such a low price point depends on various factors, making the probability moderate.

predictions.prediction: Solar and LLMs will bloom.
predictions.justification: Both solar energy and LLMs are experiencing rapid growth and adoption.  Solar energy is increasingly cost-competitive and enjoys strong political support. LLMs are demonstrating increasing capabilities and utility across various applications.  Their continued growth appears highly likely.

predictions.prediction: Cheap AI nose sniffs out many common diseases. Automatic data analysis of Gas Chromatography and spectroscopy readings on patients' VOC(volatile organic compounds) produces fast and cheap diagnosis.
predictions.justification: AI-powered diagnostic tools using VOC analysis are a developing area of research. While promising, widespread adoption and effectiveness are still uncertain.

predictions.prediction: A widespread and/or less expensive version of "robot nose" will be able to sniff out diseases.
predictions.justification: Research on robot noses for disease detection is ongoing and showing promise.  The cost and widespread availability are the main uncertainties, thus making the prediction plausible but not certain.

predictions.prediction: The cost of a line of code will continue to drop.
predictions.justification: Automation and increased developer tools efficiency are continuously driving down development costs, including the cost per line of code.

predictions.prediction: Miraculously, Truth Social and X will be exempt from the same controls put on other platforms. Justified on the basis that they are official communication channels for the government.
predictions.justification: Highly unlikely. While some governments might explore using these platforms, granting them exemptions from standard regulations would face significant legal and ethical challenges, especially regarding free speech and censorship.

predictions.prediction: chat.com getting 10% or higher marketshare.
predictions.justification: Gaining significant market share against established giants like Google is challenging, but not impossible.  The success of chat.com depends on factors like user experience, innovation, and marketing, making a 10% market share a possibility but not a certainty.

predictions.prediction: No Quantum news
predictions.justification: Given the rapid advancements and investments in quantum computing, significant news or breakthroughs are highly likely.

predictions.prediction: Year of the Linux Desktop [2]
predictions.justification: While Linux continues to improve, significant market share gains against established desktop operating systems are highly improbable in the near term. This prediction is likely a joke.

predictions.prediction: Flynn effect is finally shown as reversed, because people utilize their LLM more and not use their mental muscles as much
predictions.justification: The impact of LLMs on cognitive abilities is still under research and definitive claims are premature.

predictions.prediction: drone tech will heat up and find its "moment"
predictions.justification: Drone technology continues to advance and find new applications, making this plausible. However, reaching a defining "moment" is less certain.

predictions.prediction: Private and public sector missions (e.g., SpaceX, NASA, ISRO) will push further into space, with a focus on lunar exploration and Mars missions.
predictions.justification: Space exploration is a priority for both public and private sectors, with ongoing and planned missions focused on lunar and Mars exploration.

predictions.prediction: We will see an exciting application of Real Time Linux.
predictions.justification: Real Time Linux has various applications, and new exciting uses are plausible, although specific predictions are difficult.

predictions.prediction: Introduction of more consumer hardware that resemble industrial hardware (crazy expensive, crazy features or quality or driven by semi-industrial requirements).
predictions.justification: Technological advancements frequently lead to consumer products adopting features and capabilities previously limited to industrial applications.  This trend is likely to continue.

predictions.prediction: Non-anthropomorphic generic AI models.
predictions.justification: The development of AI models is moving towards more general-purpose applications, and non-anthropomorphic forms are likely to emerge as they offer functional advantages.

predictions.prediction: The first mainstream consumer AR glasses hit the market, but they're clunky and limited.
predictions.justification: Technological advancements are pushing towards the development of consumer AR glasses. However, achieving a user-friendly and cost-effective product with widespread appeal remains a challenge, suggesting that initial versions might be limited in functionality and design.

predictions.prediction: The shortage of high-end GPUs starts to ease as new fabs come online, but the industry faces a new bottleneck in networking equipment and specialized AI accelerators.
predictions.justification: Increased production capacity for GPUs is expected to alleviate shortages. However, the demand for other specialized hardware components might create new bottlenecks in the AI hardware supply chain.

predictions.prediction: 128GB becomes the new GPU gmr/LLM market segment target
predictions.justification: Hardware requirements for LLMs are likely to continue increasing.

predictions.prediction: The jump in reasoning ability from 4o to o3 will enable a drastic improvement in planning and execution within our human defined frameworks.
predictions.justification: Improvements in AI reasoning are expected. However, 'drastic' improvements within human-defined frameworks are uncertain and depend on various factors.

predictions.prediction: RL fine tuning will enable the model to learn better general approaches to planning and executing steps to complete work.
predictions.justification: RL fine-tuning is a promising technique for improving AI planning and execution capabilities. It's likely to lead to better general approaches, but the extent of improvement remains to be seen.

predictions.prediction: the ability to easily train the system to complete your tasks successfully with full desktop usage is going to be a major unlock for enterprises.
predictions.justification: Simplified training for desktop automation could be transformative for enterprises. This prediction is plausible and aligns with current trends in AI development.

predictions.prediction: Open Source LLM takes lead in ARC benchmark
predictions.justification: Open-source LLMs are rapidly evolving. Taking the lead in a benchmark is a plausible outcome given the current trajectory of development.

predictions.prediction: An effective algorithm for simulating a quantum computer at any scale is discovered but becomes 'born secret'.
predictions.justification: Quantum computing advancements are ongoing, but classifying a fundamental algorithm as 'born secret' is unlikely.

themes.summary: Predictions about economic trends, market changes, and financial situations.

predictions.prediction: We'll see the worlds first trillionaire
predictions.justification: While wealth concentration is increasing, reaching a trillion-dollar net worth is a significant leap. Current economic conditions and potential regulations make this unlikely in the near future.

predictions.prediction: The NASDAQ doubles.
predictions.justification: The NASDAQ is influenced by various factors, and while doubling is possible, it's hard to predict with certainty. It depends on the time horizon and several economic factors.

predictions.prediction: giant global debit maturity wall from covid that needs refinancing at much higher interest rates that starts coming due in 2026 and 2027.
predictions.justification: The pandemic led to increased debt levels globally. Refinancing at higher interest rates is a plausible scenario given changing economic conditions. However, the specific timing and magnitude of the "wall" are uncertain.

predictions.prediction: liquidity problem from debt refinancing is much nearer
predictions.justification: Refinancing large amounts of debt can present liquidity challenges, particularly in a rising interest rate environment.  The probability is high given observed trends, but the precise timing and severity remain uncertain.

predictions.prediction: US budget deficit over 35%
predictions.justification: While deficits have been high, reaching and sustaining a level above 35% would require significant shifts in spending or revenue patterns, making this prediction less likely in the near term.

predictions.prediction: fewer and fewer external parties willing to lend to the US at low rates
predictions.justification: Increased debt levels and perceived risk can lead to higher borrowing costs for governments. This trend is already observable to some extent, but the future willingness of lenders is subject to market dynamics.

predictions.prediction: Western Europe is in a broadly similar state as US
predictions.justification: Many Western European countries face similar challenges related to debt levels and potential fiscal pressures.  However, specific circumstances vary by country.

predictions.prediction: Interest paid on treasury bonds is a policy choice.
predictions.justification: This is already a well-established fact. Governments set the coupon rates on newly issued bonds.

predictions.prediction: There is no default risk, and the govt could easily implement ZIRP forever and run the economy without monetary policy entirely.
predictions.justification: While there is very low default risk for developed countries such as the U.S. with their own central banks, the idea that there is *no* default risk is a simplification. Circumstances can arise that could cause a sovereign debt crisis. Running ZIRP (zero interest rate policy) forever and abandoning monetary policy altogether is extremely unorthodox, and highly unlikely to be adopted by any major economy.

predictions.prediction: BTC/Tech crash
predictions.justification: Market crashes are difficult to predict. While market fluctuations occur, predicting a specific crash in BTC/Tech is speculative.

predictions.prediction: Hedge funds are holding cash, or liquid.
predictions.justification: Hedge funds often maintain liquidity to capitalize on market opportunities or protect against downturns. This behavior is consistent with general hedge fund strategies.

predictions.prediction: BTC's market cap increases 5x-10x per $1 in inflow it receives
predictions.justification: Attributing such a dramatic market cap increase solely to inflows is an oversimplification.  Market capitalization is influenced by a combination of factors, and a direct 5x-10x growth per $1 inflow is highly unlikely. Market behavior is much more complex than that.

predictions.prediction: CAD/USD continues to fall, Canadian dollar to US$0.65
predictions.justification: Currency exchange rates are influenced by numerous factors and are difficult to predict accurately. While further decline in the Canadian dollar is possible, reaching US$0.65 is uncertain.

themes.summary: Predictions focused on political events, social changes, and international relations.

predictions.prediction: US marked increase in military-industrial complex spending, perhaps $800B/y (75% probability)
predictions.justification: Geopolitical factors and domestic priorities could drive increased military spending, but a specific figure like $800B/year is difficult to predict with high certainty.

predictions.prediction: What will follow may tell us in which flavor of dystopia we are in, either denialism and escapism keeping business as usual, or "emergency measures" with some sectors grabbing even more power.
predictions.justification: The prediction presents two plausible scenarios, both reflecting potential societal responses to worsening global crises.  While "dystopia" is subjective, the scenarios described are possible.

predictions.prediction: Stability will continue to wane as it has since the Afghani evacuation
predictions.justification: Geopolitical instability is a continuing trend, making further decline plausible.

predictions.prediction: There will be a general purposelessness among youngsters because of this.
predictions.justification: Increased unemployment due to AI could potentially lead to a sense of purposelessness among some young people.  However, it's important to consider the adaptability and resilience of younger generations.  New opportunities and avenues for purpose may also emerge.  "General purposelessness" is a broad generalization and difficult to quantify.

predictions.prediction: It took a while for countries across the world to get high speed internet.
predictions.justification: This is a statement of fact.  The global adoption of high-speed internet has been a gradual process, with different countries gaining access at varying rates.

predictions.prediction: Some minor chaos in social networks will ensure because of a fake Putin/Trump video or whatever.
predictions.justification: The potential for misuse of AI-generated media to create fake videos and spread misinformation is high. This could indeed cause chaos on social networks, especially regarding influential figures.

predictions.prediction: Efforts to protect ecosystems and endangered species will become more urgent.
predictions.justification: The biodiversity crisis is intensifying, making conservation efforts more urgent and a continued focus for environmental organizations.

predictions.prediction: Growth of communities in spaces like Discord, Reddit, and LinkedIn for networking and learning.
predictions.justification: Online communities are already thriving, and their use for networking and learning is likely to continue growing.

predictions.prediction: US prioritizes LNG development and export.
predictions.justification: Given the current global energy landscape and the US's position as a major energy producer, prioritizing LNG development and export aligns with existing trends and political strategies.

predictions.prediction: We will look back on this year as the year that started inhumane physical/psychological experiments similar to Tuskegee using technology and vulnerable populations.
predictions.justification: While ethical concerns around technology exist, drawing a direct parallel to the Tuskegee experiments is a serious claim requiring substantial evidence, making it low probability without further information.

predictions.prediction: There will be at least one government fall in France.
predictions.justification: Government stability can shift, but predicting a fall requires specific context and indicators, making it a moderate probability prediction without more information.

predictions.prediction: Trump tax cuts expire.
predictions.justification: Tax cuts typically have expiration dates unless extended by legislation.  Given the political landscape and current debates on fiscal policy, it's highly probable the Trump tax cuts will expire.

predictions.prediction: The margins in congress are a lot tighter this time for the Republican party in the house.
predictions.justification: Predicting election outcomes is inherently difficult. Many factors influence election results, making it challenging to accurately assess the likelihood of tighter margins for the Republican party in future congressional elections.

predictions.prediction: Info and culture war stuff remains an attackers arena.
predictions.justification: The current online environment favors those seeking to spread misinformation and engage in inflammatory rhetoric.  Mitigation efforts are ongoing but face significant challenges.

predictions.prediction: Trump to meet Putin in person
predictions.justification: Given current geopolitical tensions and domestic political considerations, a meeting between Trump and Putin is improbable, though not impossible.

predictions.prediction: At least one FAANG gets split up properly, possibly multiple. They've been annoying too many governments for too long.
predictions.justification: Governments are scrutinizing Big Tech, but actual breakups require extensive legal processes and face strong resistance. While possible, the probability remains moderate.

predictions.prediction: 3rd-party driven interference and the imposition/coercion of cost exceeding means will continue further following and enforcing the trend of lower birth rates
predictions.justification: This is a vague and complex claim. While factors like economic hardship can influence birth rates, attributing it to "3rd-party interference" is speculative and lacks evidence.

predictions.prediction: For a period of time you'd need to buy Patriot missiles, 155mm shells and a ton of other stuff from the US.
predictions.justification: Ukraine's reliance on US-supplied weaponry and ammunition, including Patriot missiles and 155mm shells, is well documented. Given the ongoing conflict and the scale of military aid required, it's highly probable that this reliance will persist for a significant period.

predictions.prediction: The mainstream Democratic party will, yet again, decide that they lost the 2024 Presidential election due to insufficiently catering to conservatives, and will once again decide on a strategy of "triangulation" in the years to come.
predictions.justification: Political strategies shift based on various factors. While there's a historical precedent for the described behavior, it's not a guaranteed outcome.

predictions.prediction: Immigration is halted or reversed in most Western countries, halving long-term GDP growth.
predictions.justification: Immigration policies are complex and vary significantly across Western countries. While some countries may experience changes in immigration patterns, a widespread halt or reversal leading to a halving of GDP growth is unlikely.

predictions.prediction: Trump makes some sort of insane offer to integrate Canada to Pierre Poilievre
predictions.justification: This prediction is highly speculative and borders on the absurd. While political maneuvering is common, a proposal of this nature is extremely unlikely.

themes.summary: Predictions about health trends, medical advancements, and disease.

predictions.prediction: Infectious diseases in children are going to explode.
predictions.justification: While there are concerns about vaccine hesitancy, "explode" is a strong term.  Increased cases are possible but a widespread explosion seems unlikely given existing healthcare infrastructure.

predictions.prediction: they will have a life threatening incident. Which Medicare will fail to cover due to its budget being cut and private health insurance companies refusing to pay for procedures the Doctor orders.
predictions.justification: Life-threatening incidents are a part of life, and healthcare costs are a concern. While Medicare cuts are possible, complete failure to cover life-threatening incidents is unlikely. Private insurance companies refusing necessary procedures is also a possibility, but less likely for truly necessary procedures due to potential legal repercussions.

predictions.prediction: A key biomedical advancement will come from China.
predictions.justification: China's investment and advancements in biomedical research make a key breakthrough plausible.

themes.summary: Predictions related to climate change, weather events, and resource management.

predictions.prediction: Hottest weather in recorded history. Extreme weather in many places not seen before.
predictions.justification: Climate change is increasing the likelihood of extreme weather events. However, predicting the *hottest* weather in history with certainty is difficult, hence the slightly lower probability.

predictions.prediction: Cost of renewable electricity in remote area becomes cheap enough to pull oxygen from air or electrosis from water to be sold as commodity.
predictions.justification: While renewable energy costs are decreasing, the timeframe and economic viability of producing and transporting oxygen or hydrogen as commodities from remote areas are highly uncertain. This is a restatement of the previous prediction.

predictions.prediction: Photovoltaic electricity generation will continue to follow the same exponential curve it has been in for the last ~70 years.
predictions.justification: Solar energy has experienced significant growth. However, maintaining an exponential curve indefinitely is challenging due to factors like land availability, material costs, and grid integration.

themes.summary: Statements that don't fit into a specific category or are about niche topics like individual companies, products, or personal achievements.

predictions.prediction: Auto makers will decide that putting 6 headlights on pickup trucks is no longer competitive.
predictions.justification: While the number of headlights on vehicles has increased over time, there is no current trend or regulation pushing for more than four headlights, let alone six.  This makes the claim of six headlights being 'no longer competitive' unlikely.

predictions.prediction: Auto makers will innovate that the world needs pickup trucks with 8 headlights, starting in 2025.
predictions.justification: Similar to the six-headlight prediction, eight headlights seem excessive.  There is no known technological demand or consumer desire driving this.  Therefore, the likelihood of automakers suddenly deciding on eight headlights by 2025 is extremely low.

predictions.prediction: The headlight "bars" like on the Rivian R1T or Cybertruck is going to be the standard going forward.
predictions.justification: Light bars offer styling and potential performance advantages.  While "standard" is a strong term, their adoption is increasing, suggesting a reasonable probability.

predictions.prediction: Gukesh Dommaraju will be the 2024 world champion.
predictions.justification: While Gukesh is a rising star with exceptional talent, becoming world champion in 2024 is highly unlikely.  The competition at the top level is fierce, and consistently dominating other top players requires immense skill and experience, which takes time to develop.

predictions.prediction: This aesthetic will be so detached from professional film world that it will take Hollywood a decade to figure out how to cash it out.
predictions.justification: While there might be initial disconnect, adaptation is likely to occur faster than a decade due to market pressures.

predictions.prediction: It's to expensive for to little results (financially).
predictions.justification: Developing and deploying AI can be costly, and not all ventures are profitable.  Financial constraints are a realistic concern.

predictions.prediction: Starship will go orbital, Blue origin will go suborbital, Boeing will hit the ground
predictions.justification: SpaceX's Starship achieving orbit is plausible. Blue Origin continuing suborbital flights is also reasonable. However, "Boeing hitting the ground" is metaphorical and its interpretation impacts the likelihood.

predictions.prediction: Blue Origin's New Glenn achieves successful booster recovery and payload to orbit delivery.
predictions.justification: Blue Origin has the technological capability, but timelines and success are not guaranteed. Moderate probability assigned

predictions.prediction: Initially this is seen as huge win and they emerge as potential challengers to SpaceX
predictions.justification: Challenging SpaceX requires substantial and sustained effort, making it not a certain outcome. Moderate probability assigned

predictions.prediction: This will be met with skepticism.
predictions.justification: New technologies, especially in the AI field, are often met with skepticism initially. Public reaction to novel technologies is generally quite predictable, thus higher probability.

predictions.prediction: Large movies and video games that cost above $200 million to make will flop around 75% or more.
predictions.justification: Predicting box office and video game sales is notoriously difficult. While some high-budget projects fail, a consistent flop rate of 75% or more for $200M+ productions is unlikely.  Market trends, marketing strategies, and audience preferences play a significant role.  High budgets don't guarantee success, but they often mitigate risk through larger marketing campaigns and established intellectual property.

predictions.prediction: BlueSky will reach 100 million users
predictions.justification: Social media platform growth is unpredictable.  Reaching 100 million users is plausible, but depends on various factors including market competition and user adoption.

predictions.prediction: Microsoft starts selling Windows Server standard at a flat 500 bucks an instance a year without the need for CALs.
predictions.justification: Microsoft's current licensing model for Windows Server is complex and highly profitable. A drastic change like this seems unlikely, though not impossible given the competitive landscape.

predictions.prediction: TSLA sales continue decline, stock continues to soar.
predictions.justification: While stock prices can be unpredictable, a sustained decline in sales coupled with a soaring stock price is unlikely. Market sentiment and other external factors can influence stock prices, but fundamental business performance usually plays a significant role in the long run.

predictions.prediction: if there are general price hikes it's easy (and sometimes necessary) to hike your own prices even if you're not directly affected. This will improve profits (at least in the short term).
predictions.justification: Businesses often adjust pricing in response to market trends, including inflation and competitor pricing. While not always easy, price increases are a common response to rising costs.

predictions.prediction: Falls around 70%.
predictions.justification: Significant price drops are possible in volatile markets like cryptocurrency. However, predicting a specific percentage decline remains speculative, making a 70% fall a less likely, though possible, scenario.

predictions.prediction: Musk will call it x-coin.
predictions.justification: While Musk has integrated crypto into his businesses and shown interest in the space, naming a hypothetical US government coin "x-coin" is speculative and depends on multiple unlikely factors.

predictions.prediction: It is the only asset that has retained high value for thousands of years.
predictions.justification: Gold has held value for thousands of years, but other assets like land and certain commodities have also maintained value over long periods. It's not the *only* asset but one of the few.

predictions.prediction: Cold fusion becomes viable and provides clean energy.
predictions.justification: While research continues, cold fusion remains highly speculative and faces significant scientific hurdles.

predictions.prediction: Starship: first attempt at the Moon, I'd guess 80%.
predictions.justification: SpaceX plans a lunar mission with Starship, but complex technical challenges and regulatory hurdles exist. 80% might be optimistic, a 50% probability is more reasonable given the inherent risks and potential delays.

predictions.prediction: NVidia will see its revenue shrink in comparison to this year.
predictions.justification: Nvidia's revenue has been strong, and market conditions can change. While competition and other factors could impact its growth, a significant shrink in revenue within a year is less probable.

predictions.prediction: US grocery prices are higher than ever.
predictions.justification: Inflation and economic factors contribute to rising food prices. While reaching record highs is possible, it depends on various market conditions and policy decisions.

themes.summary: Statements related to the growth and market share of solar energy.

predictions.prediction: Solar energy will account for around 8% (give or take 1%?) of the worlds energy usage
predictions.justification: Solar energy is experiencing rapid growth and adoption globally. Reaching 7-9% of global energy usage within the next few years is highly plausible given current trends and technological advancements.

predictions.prediction: Market share for solar continues to increase
predictions.justification: The solar market is consistently growing, making further increase in market share highly probable.

predictions.prediction: PV increases 20-26%
predictions.justification: Solar photovoltaic (PV) growth is expected to remain strong due to decreasing costs and increasing demand.  This range aligns with industry projections.

themes.summary: Statements about improvements and cost reductions in battery production.

predictions.prediction: Battery production increases by about 33% while getting about 14% cheaper per unit
predictions.justification: Increasing demand for batteries in various applications drives production growth and cost reductions. These figures are plausible given current industry trends.

themes.summary: These statements do not fit into a cohesive theme and cover unrelated topics such as a grid disruption event and a hypothetical merger.

predictions.prediction: A solar storm wipes out 20% of the US grid.
predictions.justification: While solar storms can disrupt power grids, a widespread outage of this magnitude is unlikely given current grid infrastructure and mitigation efforts.

predictions.prediction: Apple and Disney will merge, raising prices to everything in the solar system.
predictions.justification: A merger of this scale faces significant antitrust scrutiny and logistical challenges, making it highly improbable.

themes.summary: Predictions about the continued and substantial improvement of generative AI in various media forms.

predictions.prediction: Generative AI for music will continue to improve substantially.
predictions.justification: AI's progress in music generation is evident. Continued substantial improvement is highly likely, given ongoing research and development efforts.

predictions.prediction: Generative AI for video will continue to improve substantially.
predictions.justification: Similar to music, AI's impact on video generation is rapidly evolving. Continued substantial improvement is highly probable given the ongoing advancements in this field.

predictions.prediction: AI image and video generated images will become almost impossible to discern from real ones.
predictions.justification: AI image and video generation technology is advancing rapidly, and it's likely that distinguishing them from real ones will become increasingly challenging.

themes.summary: Predictions about the impact of generative AI on independent film and music video production.

predictions.prediction: There will be a breakout indie film or music video that's produced from a skeleton crew relying heavily on generative AI video.
predictions.justification: AI's role in video production is increasing, but a "breakout" indie film heavily reliant on AI faces creative and market acceptance challenges, making the probability moderate.

themes.summary: Predictions about the increasing use of AI tools, especially those from China, by hobbyist filmmakers on platforms like YouTube.

predictions.prediction: The real AI film wave will continue in youtube etc. by hobbyists using all the AI tools especially the chinese ones that have no brakes.
predictions.justification: Experimentation with AI tools is easily accessible and there's high activity within communities outside professional film.

themes.summary: Predictions related to international conflicts, political tensions, and the global balance of power.

predictions.prediction: Europe seems heavily distracted with its regulations and politics.
predictions.justification: Europe's focus on regulatory frameworks and political considerations regarding AI is evident, making this a highly probable observation.

predictions.prediction: a head to head battle between USA and China [in open source AI]
predictions.justification: The US and China are currently leading in AI development, suggesting a likely continuation of competition in the open-source AI domain.

predictions.prediction: Unsustainable public debt, specifically $50 trillion in debt maturity that needs to be rolled over mid-2025, will cause significant problems.
predictions.justification: The large amount of debt maturing represents a substantial financial hurdle and refinancing risk. While unlikely to cause a complete collapse, the sheer volume creates potential instability and necessitates careful management. Rolling over such a substantial amount presents logistical challenges and potential market disruptions.

predictions.prediction: US major cyberattack crippling infrastructure (50% probability)
predictions.justification: The increasing frequency and sophistication of cyberattacks make a major infrastructure-crippling attack plausible. A 50% probability acknowledges the possibility while also reflecting the inherent uncertainties.

predictions.prediction: Most Chinese companies are state-owned and cannot be invested in.
predictions.justification: While a significant portion of Chinese companies have state involvement, not all are entirely state-owned or inaccessible to investment.  The extent of state ownership varies across sectors.

predictions.prediction: Foreign equities have the risk of running into a government crackdown.
predictions.justification: The Chinese government has demonstrated a willingness to intervene in various sectors, creating uncertainty for foreign investors.  However, the extent and targets of future crackdowns are difficult to predict with certainty.

predictions.prediction: capital controls will be harder to enforce in the modern world where one can buy gold, bitcoin or any of 100+ currencies
predictions.justification: The increasing availability of alternative assets and currencies does make enforcing strict capital controls more challenging than in the past.

predictions.prediction: Politics and financial markets in turmoil as a result of geopolitical tensions and erosion of public trust in US among its populace
predictions.justification: Geopolitical tensions and public trust are significant factors impacting political and financial stability.

predictions.prediction: US will continue to remain somewhat the way it is despite presidential choice because we're geographically isolated and (nearly?) energy independent. We'll probably hit some records for crude oil and natural gas extraction.
predictions.justification: US geopolitical and energy independence supports relative stability.

predictions.prediction: Canada's government doesn't seem to a good way out of their current situation which blows my mind given the abundance of resources in the county. Their access to made in US weapons may become more of a pressing issue.
predictions.justification: Predicting Canada's specific challenges and access to US weapons is speculative.

predictions.prediction: The US creates a pretext to go to war with Iran and is defeated
predictions.justification: Predicting geopolitical events is complex and fraught with uncertainty.  This specific scenario is highly speculative and unlikely.

predictions.prediction: China tests US response to Taiwan under Trump with significant but limited escalation
predictions.justification: Geopolitical tensions between China and Taiwan are ongoing.  Testing the US response is a plausible scenario, but the extent of escalation is uncertain.

predictions.prediction: Putin will launch a nuclear strike against Ukraine.
predictions.justification: Such an action would have catastrophic global consequences, and while tensions are high, the probability of a nuclear strike remains very low.

predictions.prediction: Russian economy flounders, ruble ends the year considerably lower against western currencies than it is now
predictions.justification: The Russian economy faces significant challenges, but predicting the ruble's exact trajectory is difficult due to various influencing factors.

predictions.prediction: Wide spread unrest in Europe, focused on cultural integration of immigrants from abroad/aforementioned military spending
predictions.justification: Social unrest related to immigration and economic pressures is a recurring theme in Europe. While widespread unrest is possible, the specific causes and extent are difficult to predict.

predictions.prediction: China declares itself the biggest and most stable global superpower.
predictions.justification: China's growing influence is evident, but such a declaration is dependent on complex international dynamics and therefore has moderate probability.

predictions.prediction: Russia's involvement in the Ukraine war hinders its participation in the AI race.
predictions.justification: The war is diverting resources and attention away from technological development.  Sanctions and strained international relations further limit Russia's access to critical technologies and collaboration opportunities, making it challenging to keep pace with the US and China in AI.

predictions.prediction: Americans can freeze and prohibit supply of military aid to the point where it won't be sustainable to resist Russian assaults.
predictions.justification: The US plays a significant role in supplying components for European weapon systems used by Ukraine.  Thus, the US has the potential to influence or limit the flow of military aid, which would impact Ukraine's defense capabilities.
